newsitem.title: GERMANY: Kohl will make no new offer to SPD on taxes -TV.
newsitem.headline: Kohl will make no new offer to SPD on taxes -TV.

text.p: German Chancellor Helmut Kohl said on Friday his coalition would make no new offer to opposition Social Democrats (SPD) on tax reform, but that it was prepared to compromise.

Asked by a RTL television interviewer whether the coalition would make a new offer, Kohl said, "No, we made a very good tax proposal...We must try to reach a compromise, so let us sit down at the table," according to a transcript of the interview.
Kohl said it was vital that Germany reduce its taxes, particularly for corporations, to boost its exports and avoid losing jobs-creating business to other countries.
"Whoever wants to block all that, should try," Kohl said. "He will be punished by the voter. That is why I am not worried."
Kohl said there was still room for compromise with the SPD, despite its previous rejection of the government's tax reform proposal, which included up to 30 billion marks in tax cuts.
The SPD stopped the plan through its majority in the upper house of parliament and in the mediation committee.
